intro: Davya glabra, commonly known as the smooth davya, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, trifoliate leaves that are smooth to the touch. The plant produces pea-like flowers that are typically pale purple or white in color. It is native to regions of southern and eastern Africa, where it thrives in open, sunny habitats. Davya glabra is often found in grasslands and along rocky outcrops, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
